content.description: The route has mostly easy climbing on large holds, especially at the beginning. The sharp rocks might be difficult for beginners. The crux is after the third bolt.
content.protection: Seven bolts along the route, plus the anchor.
content.location: This route is to the right of the left-most route. It has the most noticeable bolts on the wall.

content.description: The crux is at the roof just before the anchor bolts. Be warned!! The crux is hard for the grade!
content.location: The Eastern-most route on the wall.

content.description: Good for beginners, this route features sections of nearly-vertical climbing with plenty of holds on either side of a corner. There is no significant crux.
content.protection: There is a two-bolt anchor at the top for top-roping. There are no bolts along the route.
content.location: This route follows an obvious corner that starts about a third the way up the wall and continues to the top. It is about eight feet to the right of Unknown 5.7. An easy way to reach the anchors is to first lead climb one of the bolted routes and then walk along the top.

content.description: Start up the route that you would take to do the unknown 5.7 sport route following the bolts. At the third bolt shimmy around a small arete to a shallow, sloping crack that juts up to the bulge on the eastern side of the face. The crux is getting around the arete and to the top of the bulge. After that it's really easy climbing to the top.
content.protection: Bolts and some small gear, chains at top
content.location: Park at the Bountiful staging area by the B on the mountains and follow the Ward Canyon trail up until you get to a large cliff just past some concrete in the ground. Walk up to set up a TR anchor on either side of the crag.
